course.subject: ISOM
course.name: Big Data Technologies
course.description: In the era of "Big Data", organizations need a new infrastructure/platform to manage the storage and processing of large volume of data. This course introduces the emerging technological paradigm of big data management, as well as some common approaches that are used to gain insights from big data for business decision-making. In particular, it covers a range of big data technologies, including HDFS, MapReduce, Spark, Hive, Pig, etc., that allow for performing data-intensive analysis.
course.prerequisites: (ISOM 3230 OR ISOM 3320 OR ISOM 3400) AND ISOM 3360

reviews.author: calycia
reviews.title: Consider the risk of studying a new course
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers the basic ideas and techniques in Big Data.
(Copied from syllabus)
• Understand MapReduce as a computation model and an execution framework
• Work with following tools in the big data application stack:
o Hadoop
o YARN
o Hive
o Pig
o Spark
o and perhaps others...
• Realize how different tools in the Hadoop stack fit in the big picture of big data analytics
• Design distributed machine learning algorithms
• Use cloud computing services (Amazon Web Services) to build your clusters and run large-scale data processing applications
reviews.comment_teaching:
Perhaps this is a VERY NEW course, even Jia Jia himself also feel confused sometimes in teaching. He tried his best to explain the concepts to us, but I guess I just could not learn the knowledge well.

P.S. Jia Jia and TA had been repeating in the add/drop period that there is risk in taking this NEW course, and telling us to drop the course if we could not take uncertainty. So this is also my advice to all of you: if you can't accept poor grade or uncertainty in courses, give up this course. (Or you can just sit in the course without enrolment cuz the course doesn't take attendance)
reviews.comment_grading:
Final grade: B

Lab Participation:10%
Easy part, just attend every lab and submit lab assignment (dun worry if it is correct or not, TA just want to make sure that you did attend the lab)
Also, TA suggested that sometimes the lab assignment may require more time to finish (a.k.a overrun), so if you consider taking this course, leave some time slots after the lab session.

Homework (4): 40%
Originally there were 4 assignments, but Jia Jia fell behind the schedule and could not finish teaching all topics. So there were just 3 assignments.
It consists of MC and short questions. I spent long time in finishing them cuz I was not sure whether I answered questions correctly. But in the end I got full marks for all homework.

Midterm quiz: 20%
It was a nightmare to me. Although we were allowed to bring a 2-sided cheat sheet, it did not help me much in the exam, except MC part which asked some facts. The short Q part was a hell to me. It asked the application of the concepts, but the only example we have is from the assignment (This is the reason why I provided suggestions of including more examples of application in the lecture in SFQ)
Fun fact is, some one got full marks :)

Final project: 30% (1/3 of which is determined by peer evaluation)
4 - 6 people in a group, choose either (1) Online Product Recommendation or (2) PageRank for Recommendation systems (movie)
The detail of the project was announced at early Nov, and seriously, the only time you can finish it is after the end of semester (deadline was 22 Dec, 2017) and my group finish it within one week before the deadline.
This project is the reason why the course adds the prerequisite of ISOM3230 (i.e. some programming knowledge) in Spring 2018, because it requires you to submit the code.
reviews.comment_workload:
If you just take a look of the syllabus, you would think the workload is okay. But considering such a topic with fast changing  techniques, the workload can be huge.

I took ISOM3360 this semester (Spring 2018) and knew that Prof. Yi Yang is going to teach this course in the next academic year.(not sure if it is Fall/ Spring, or both) Maybe a new prof can bring a different approach in teaching this course :)

reviews.author: Timo
reviews.comment_content: It is indeed very hard and complicated.  It is fast changing, thus hard to find comprehensive tutorial online too.  Frankly Jiajia is not sure about some topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Jiajia cannot express himself freely in English most of the time, but he tries to do it slowly in class
reviews.comment_grading: Fair, attend all labs and assignments is not that hard, can consult TA who is helpful if needed
reviews.comment_workload: Acceptable.  No final exam might be a plus for some of you, but you need to team up to finish a group project, quite a lot of time needed for that.

reviews.author: LucasTheBeast
reviews.title: New course Big Data technologies
reviews.comment_content: Content is about hadoop and big data technologies. High-level overview and also some hands-on experience. During the course basic tools like Hive etc. are used
reviews.comment_teaching: After first lecture course look very interesting although professors is not big fan of working with large datasets. No coding in this course only pieces of codes should be provided
reviews.comment_grading: Mid term test, final test, homework, lab attandance
reviews.comment_workload: Seems to be appropriate to 3 credits, there is mid term test and also some homeworks and attendance is mandatory during the laboratory classes.
